title: Price Sensitivity and Competitive Dynamics in Urban Coffee Markets
abstract: Investigation of 5,000 consumers across 12 metropolitan areas reveals price elasticity of -1.4 for coffee products. Customers who visit competitors weekly are 2.1x more price-sensitive. Quality perception mediates price sensitivity (β=0.42, SE=0.08).
key_findings: Competitor visits increase price sensitivity by 110%
Income correlates positively with quality preference (r=0.58)
methods: Conjoint analysis, structural equation modeling, market segmentation
